column4: Hi, how can I share a wvdial connection with another computer with Ubuntu and one with XP?
the easiest way is to install firestarter. on the first run it will ask you if you want to share the connection
cool, thanks
and how can I let Firestarter start automatically when I start the computer?
it does. you don't have to do anything
ah, so the icon at the panel isn't required?
nope
it is started as a daemon when you boot
:) and how can I configure the other computers to go throught this one?
tell them that this computer is your gateway
yes, but how?
at proxy configuration (on ubuntu)?
you said the other machine is a winbox?
there are two, a XP and a Ubuntu Feisty
look around in the  "network configuration" dialog. there should be a setting for "default gateway"
don't know exactly how it is named or where to look
ok, found it. what IP should I write there?
the ip of the machine which is connected to the net
to find out it's ip address run "ifconfig" on this machine

I configured Feisty's connection with static ip, ip: 10.0.0.3, submask: 255.0.0.0, gateway: 10.0.0.1, and pings to 10.0.0.1 are working (firestarter also says 0.2kb/s incoming on eth1) but I can't ping any site (nor domain nor ip) from outsite
is you internet connection up?
yes
out of ideas. it should work if it's done correctly
ok, thank you
